item.title: Using impact maps to improve product delivery
item.description: WORK IN PRGRESS… Software is everywhere today, but countless software products and projects die a slow death without ever making any impact. The result is a tremendous amount of time and money wasted due to wrong assumptions, lack of focus, poor communication of objectives, lack of understanding and misalignment with overall goals. Upfront plans are inadequate because the landscape changes too frequently. But iterative delivery plans often lack a big picture.

item.title: Why we think smaller teams are better
item.description: Over the years I’ve worked on lots of teams. Some good, and some not so. But what is it that makes a team successful? There are the obvious things like the kind of people you have on the team. If the team members just don’t get on, if they don’t have the skills required to do the job, or they just aren’t interested in working hard then it’s clear the team will suffer.

item.title: Our Story
item.description: Andy, Jon and Gordon are software developers. It’s what they do. They enjoy developing good quality software. It makes them happy. They’ve been developing software individually for more than twenty years. Fate brought them together when, as individuals, they worked with Just Eat. Andy, Jon and Gordon got on well together. Jon and Gordon worked in the same team. Jon, Gordon and Andy worked in the same office space. They ate lunch together and had many, many conversations about the process of software development and the tools and technolgies that help with that.

item.title: Our Values
item.description: You might recognise our values. When we came together as a partnership one of the first things we did was to list all the things we would always do and all the things we would never do. For example, some of things that appeared in the ‘always do’ list were to be open and transparent about what we do, communicate both good and bad news, work collaboratively and deliver software we are proud of.

item.title: Ready to start?
item.description: As always, the best way to start is with a conversation. Send us your details and let's start talking!
